Значения

Слово

Мнемоника

Устная и письменная речь 言 кандидата на звание чиновника 司 отличается изяществом. Словесность, речь.

heisig_chinese_memo: The big mouthed director is even picky about the parts of speech of the words you use, shouting, "More verbs! Less adjectives!" all the time.
heisig_constituent: part of speech, say, words, keitai, mouth, director, Ken Russel, clothes hanger, coat hanger, one, mouth, mouth2
heisig_story: The key word, parts of speech, refers to nouns, verbs, adjective, adverbs, and so on. The elements: words . . . directors.
koohiiStory1: Parts of speech act as word directors, giving it meaning and indicating its correct placement and usage in grammar.
koohiiStory2: The big mouthed diretor is even picky about the parts of speech you use, shouting, "More verbs! Less adjectives!" and such all the time.
jp_example_words:
自動詞(じどうし): intransitive verb (no direct obj)
助詞(じょし): particle, postposition
助動詞(じょどうし): auxiliary verb
数詞(すうし): numeral
接続詞(せつぞくし): conjunction
他動詞(たどうし): transitive verb (direct obj)
形容詞(けいようし): "true" adjective
形容動詞(けいようどうし): adjectival noun, quasi-adjective
代名詞(だいめいし): pronoun
動詞(どうし): verb
副詞(ふくし): adverb
名詞(めいし): noun
WaniKani_Kanji_Meaning: Part Of Speech, Speech Particle, Particle Of Speech, Grammar Particle
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: What you say to the director is judged immediately. You're having trouble understanding this part of speech, so he's trying to help you. But you say it over and over and he keeps saying you're wrong.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info:
"Is it an adjective?"
"No, that's the wrong part of speech."
"Is it a verb?"
"N-no! Of course not!"
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The director asks you again, "What is the part of speech for the word sheep (し)?"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You stare blankly at him. What part of speech is that?! It's an animal, you know that. Oh! A noun. Duh.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 詩 (うた、シ стихи), 誌 (シ журнал).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 亅 (зазубрина), 口 (рот), 言 (слово)

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When you say sentences you are taking charge of the words of a language.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " speak " and " si ", modern linguistics means that the smallest phonological unit can be used independently in the language. Lu Xun’s "Qiejieting Essays Two Episodes-Life Literacy Hu Tushi": "When they were learning Chinese, they had no teachers, no grammar textbooks, no dictionaries. They just kept listening, remembering, analyzing, and comparing, and finally understood every word. significance."

" Words " can mean words. "Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Reflecting Thoughts": "Keep the little affection with the old words, and correct the widow's beauty."

" Words " also mean literary words. "Zihui‧ Yanbu": "Ci, Wen Ye." Tan Dufu "Zhuang You": "Xu Yu must be a poet, appreciate the real king." It means that what you think you can associate with must be better than literary For the elders of the literary world, it is the virtuous king who travels together.

" Words " can express excuses and reasons. Song Su Shunqin's "Book of King Zhao Du in Shangjing": "Although the loyal minister is in Wanmu, he does not forget his prince. There is no such thing as alienation."

" Word " can also express the name of the style. Song Su Shi's "Book with Cai Jingfan" fourth: "Issuing new words, this ancient poet also has long and short lines."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " words " and " si " sounds, modern linguistics means that the smallest phonetic unit can be used independently in a language.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「司」聲，現代語言學表示語言中可獨立運用最小音義單位。魯迅《且介亭雜文二集‧人生識字胡塗始》：「他們學話的時候，沒有教師，沒有語法教科書，沒有字典，只是不斷的聽取，記住，分析，比較，終於懂得每個詞的意義。」

　　「詞」可表示話語。《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「結微情以陳詞兮，矯以遺夫美人。」

　　「詞」也表示文辭。《字彙‧言部》：「詞，文也。」唐杜甫〈壯遊〉：「許與必詞伯，賞遊實賢王。」意謂自己認為可以與之交往的，必是長於文辭的文壇長者，攜手遊賞的必是賢王。

　　「詞」可表示藉口、理由。宋蘇舜欽〈上京兆杜公書〉：「況忠臣雖在畎畝，不忘其君，無以疏外為詞。」

　　「詞」還可表示文體之名。宋蘇軾〈與蔡景繁書〉之四：「頒示新詞，此古人長短句詩也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，「司」聲，現代語言學表示語言中可獨立運用最小音義單位。

Chinese Definition:

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 司 [ sī ] to take charge of, to control, to manage; officer
①語言裏最小的可以獨立運用的單位：詞彙。詞書。詞典。詞句。詞序。詞組。
②言辭，話語，泛指寫詩作文：歌詞。演講詞。誓詞。詞章。詞律(文詞的聲律)。
③中國一種詩體(起於南朝，形成於唐代，盛行於宋代。本可入樂歌唱，後樂譜失傳，只按詞牌格律創作)：詞人。詞譜。詞牌。詞調(diào)。詞韻。詞曲。

從「 言 」，「 司 」聲，現代語言學表示語言中可獨立運用最小音義單位。魯迅《且介亭雜文二集‧人生識字胡塗始》：「他們學話的時候，沒有教師，沒有語法教科書，沒有字典，只是不斷的聽取，記住，分析，比較，終於懂得每個詞的意義。」 「 詞 」可表示話語。《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「結微情以陳詞兮，矯以遺夫美人。」 「 詞 」也表示文辭。《字彙‧言部》：「詞，文也。」唐杜甫〈壯遊〉：「許與必詞伯，賞遊實賢王。」意謂自己認為可以與之交往的，必是長於文辭的文壇長者，攜手遊賞的必是賢王。 「 詞 」可表示藉口、理由。宋蘇舜欽〈上京兆杜公書〉：「況忠臣雖在畎畝，不忘其君，無以疏外為詞。」 「 詞 」還可表示文體之名。宋蘇軾〈與蔡景繁書〉之四：「頒示新詞，此古人長短句詩也。」
From the sound of " speak" and " si", modern linguistics means that the smallest phonological unit can be used independently in the language. Lu Xun’s "Qiejieting Essays Two Episodes-Life Literacy Hu Tushi": "When they were learning Chinese, they had no teachers, no grammar textbooks, no dictionaries. They just kept listening, remembering, analyzing, and comparing, and finally understood every word. significance." " Words" can mean words. "Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Reflecting Thoughts": "Keep the little affection with the old words, and correct the widow's beauty." " Words" also mean literary words. "Zihui‧ Yanbu": "Ci, Wen Ye." Tan Dufu "Zhuang You": "Xu Yu must be a poet, appreciate the real king." It means that what you think you can associate with must be better than literary For the elders of the literary world, it is the virtuous king who travels together. " Words" can express excuses and reasons. Song Su Shunqin's "Book of King Zhao Du in Shangjing": "Although the loyal minister is in Wanmu, he does not forget his prince. There is no such thing as alienation." " Word" can also express the name of the style. Song Su Shi's "Book with Cai Jingfan" fourth: "Issuing new words, this ancient poet also has long and short lines."

詞字的基本解释

詞
cí
见“词”。

詞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cí］
［《廣韻》似兹切，平之，邪。］
“词1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)言辞；文辞。
(2)诉讼。
(3)指讼词。
(4)借口；理由。
(5)语言组织中的基本单位，能独立运用，具有声音、意义和语法功能。
(6)旧时亦专指语助词、虚词。
(7)文体名。古代乐府诗体的一种。
(8)文体名。按谱填写，可合乐歌唱，渊源于南朝，始于唐，盛于宋的一种诗体。亦称“詩餘”、“長短句”。
(9)文体名。泛指戏剧、讲唱、歌曲等艺术中的语言、文字部分。
(10)通“辭”。告别。
(11)通“辭”。违戾。参见“詞向”、“詞乖”。
(12)通“嗣”。承继。

詞字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　詞； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1156第09
〔古文〕?【唐韻】似兹切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】詳兹切，?音祠。【說文】意內而言外也。【釋名】嗣也。令撰善言，相嗣續也。【廣韻】說也。【正韻】言也。【字彙】文也。【公羊傳·昭十一年】春秋之信史也。其詞則丘有罪焉爾。【史記·儒林傳】是時天子方好文詞。【晉書·郭璞傳】璞詞賦爲中興之冠。【舊唐書·張九齡傳】張說常謂人曰：後來詞人稱首也。又【陸贄傳】贄以博學宏詞登科。【韓非子·問田篇】驅於聲詞，眩乎辯說。　又【博雅】已也。　又【廣韻】請也，吿也。○按《說文》本作意內言外。韻會引作音內言外。又引徐曰：惟也，思也，曰也，兮也，斯也。若此之類，皆詞也，語之助也。聲成文謂之音，此詞直音內之助，聲不出於音，故曰音之內。直言曰言，一字曰言，此詞皆在句之外爲助，故曰言之外。楚辭宋玉招魂：魂兮歸來，東方不可以託些。些，亦詞也。未詳音發爲言，言之成文爲詞，未可以內外岐之，且詞與兮些各別，非語助例也。字彙勦用韻會舊註，非是。又按說文辭，訟也。辤，不受也。與言詞、文詞之詞各

word
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cí］
["Guangyun" is like a cut, flat and evil. ]
Traditional characters for "Word 1". Also known as "1".
(1) Words; literary words.
(2) Litigation.
(3) Refers to litigation.
(4) Excuses; reasons.
(5) The basic unit in language organization, which can be used independently, with sound, meaning and grammatical functions.
(6) In the old days, it also specifically referred to auxiliary words and function words.
(7) The name of the style. A type of ancient Yuefu poetry.
(8) The name of the style. Fill in according to the score and sing with music together. It originated in the Southern Dynasties, began in the Tang Dynasty, and flourished in the Song Dynasty. Also known as "Shi Yu", "Long and Short Sentences".
(9) The name of the style. Refers to the language and text part of the arts such as drama, speaking and singing, and songs.
(10) Through "ci". bid farewell.
(11) Through "ci". Violation. See "cixiang", "ciguai".
(12) Through "heir". Inherited.

вм. 词
Radicals: 言, 司  (say, director)
Meaning Mnemonic
What you say to the director is judged immediately. You're having trouble understanding this part of speech, so he's trying to help you. But you say it over and over and he keeps saying you're wrong.
"Is it an adjective?"
"No, that's the wrong part of speech."
"Is it a verb?"
"N-no! Of course not!"
Reading Mnemonic
The director asks you again, "What is the part of speech for the word sheep (し)?"
You stare blankly at him. What part of speech is that?! It's an animal, you know that. Oh! A noun. Duh.
